RISK_SCORE.long_description: In the NRI, the score includes three components: a natural hazards risk component, a consequence enhancing component (social vulnerability), and a consequence reduction component (community resilience).
RISK_SCORE.short_description: The NRI score is a unitless index (0 minimum risk, 100 maximum risk) calculated to measure a community’s risk to all 18 hazard types.

sources.name: Federal Emergency Management Agency: National Risk Index

RISK_SCORE.statement: {features.name} has a risk index value of {value} where 0 is the minimum and 100 is the maximum.
